blog.name: 9or10allgood
blog.title: Winter Storm Warning...
blog.description:
Just a hair older than middle-aged, mother, transplanted Georgian living in Texas. I love my son more than my life. I'm a bit of a nerd - Whovian since forever. I would say I'm in love with David Tennant but a woman my age should be beyond such shenanigans. Or so I've been told.

Also a fan of NCIS, NCIS:Los Angeles, Star Trek (in all its permutations), Top Gear UK (before the *ahem* dust up) and The Grand Tour, The Big Bang Theory, and The West Wing.

Also, The Wheel of Time. The Dragon Rides the Winds of Time - Forever.

Politically moderate, socially liberal, spiritual, sarcastic. Frustrated inventor, meteorologist wannabe. And I would go to space in a heartbeat.

Anti-Trump - now and always.

On the subject of Doctor Who and Moffat, think of me as Switzerland. Determined to remain neutral. Open to the good, acknowledging the bad, not willing to fight about it.

Have some chocolate. ;)

body:
I started watching gen: LOCK. So this is an anime not made by the Japanese, where there is a character with habits and the voice of the Tenth Doctor and the appearance of Hank from Detroit.
I already like it.

tags: I love how game she is
I want to be that way too
david tennant is far too fast indeed
summary:
Behind the Scene of The Waters of Mars (Part 10)

  Excerpts from a TV Guide interview with Lindsay Duncan for The Waters of...
caption:
Behind the Scene of The Waters of Mars (Part 10)

Excerpts from a TV Guide interview with Lindsay Duncan for The Waters of Mars:

One thing actors on Doctor Who need to know: there’s an awful lot of running. “David Tennant is far too fast,” gasps Lindsay Duncan, who stars in the feature-length special The Waters of Mars. “I wouldn’t say I became competitive, but I did think, ‘Well, bloody hell, if there’s running going on, then I’m running.’ I ended up straining a muscle in my thigh…”

For an actress who’s clocked up a huge number of prestigious, award-winning jobs, you might think that Doctor Who wouldn’t appeal.  “Oh gosh!” she exclaims. “Of course it does! Everyone wants to do Doctor Who.  The opportunity came up before but it didn’t work out. It’s just so creative what David and [series producer/writer] Russell T. Davies are doing. They’ve really raised the bar.”

“I’ve never worked with David before,” she continues, “and there is a slight age gap. But we’ve got a similar sort of background. We’ve both done a broad range of stuff and lots of theatre.”

The Doctor Who special is not Lindsay’s first brush with science fiction, having voiced an android in Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace.  There was even an action figure made of her character. “That was an achievement,” she laughs. “Adelaide [her character in The Waters of Mars] definitely deserves one, too. Who do I lobby to make it happen?”

Other Waters of Mars behind-the-scenes posts: [ one ] [ two ] [ three ] [ four ] [ five ] [ six ] [ seven ] [ eight ] [ nine ]
Full list of behind-the-scenes posts:  [ here ]

summary:
Wow
I'm reading "Good Omens" and just "wow". It was a really powerful moment. Crowley is the angstest creature in the world! 
He...
body:
Wow

I’m reading “Good Omens” and just “wow”. It was a really powerful moment. Crowley is the angstest creature in the world!

He is not a Demon or an Angel. He is such a human being!

I’ve read 70 pages and understand that it’s one of the best books. How it can be so funny and so sad at the same time? 😥

reblog.comment:

blog.name: whovianfloozy
blog.title: The Whovian Floozy
blog.description:
My fandom name is Beachy, and this is a multi-fandom blog. 
I'm also a multi-shipper. It's likely I do not sail your ship, but I don't wank and expect visitors to play nicely as well. That includes not adding hate or negativity to my posts, altering them to suit your own ships, or removing my original comments. If you do, you will be blocked.
IRL they call me Doctor. Yep, I'm that old. Sometimes I write things that other people watch. It's all good! I like mocha latte with bourbon. A lot.
